pytket.routing¶

class pytket._tket.routing.Architecture¶

The base architecture class, describing the connectivity of qubits on a device.

__init__(*args, **kwargs)¶

Overloaded function.

  1. __init__(self: pytket._tket.routing.Architecture, connections: List[Tuple[int, int]]) -> None

The constructor for an architecture with connectivity between qubits.

Parameters

connections – A list of pairs representing qubit indices that can perform two-qubit operations

  1. __init__(self: pytket._tket.routing.Architecture, connections: List[Tuple[pytket._tket.circuit.Node, pytket._tket.circuit.Node]]) -> None

The constructor for an architecture with connectivity between qubits.

Parameters

connections – A list of pairs representing Nodes that can perform two-qubit operations

property coupling¶

Returns the coupling map of the Architecture as UnitIDs.

property nodes¶

Returns all nodes of architecture as UnitID objects.

class pytket._tket.routing.CyclicButterfly¶

Architecture class for a cyclic butterfly graph of given dimension.

__init__(self: pytket._tket.routing.CyclicButterfly, dimension: int) → None¶

Constructor for CyclicButterfly graph with some undirected connectivity between qubits.

:param dimension

class pytket._tket.routing.FullyConnected¶

Architecture class for number of qubits connected to every other qubit.

__init__(self: pytket._tket.routing.FullyConnected, nodes: int) → None¶

The constructor for a FullyConnected Architecture with some undirected connectivity between qubits.

:param number of qubits

class pytket._tket.routing.GraphPlacement¶

The GraphPlacement class, contains methods for getting maps between Circuit Qubits and Device Nodes and for relabelling Circuit Qubits.

__init__(self: pytket._tket.routing.GraphPlacement, device: tket::Device) → None¶

The constructor for a GraphPlacement object. The Device object contains an architecture which details connectivity between qubits.

Parameters

device – A Device object.

get_placement_map(self: pytket._tket.routing.GraphPlacement, circuit: pytket._tket.circuit.Circuit) → pytket._tket.routing.QubitMap¶

Returns a QubitMap object that is Device appropriate for the given Circuit.

Parameters

circuit – The circuit a map is designed for.

get_placement_maps(self: pytket._tket.routing.GraphPlacement, circuit: pytket._tket.circuit.Circuit) → List[pytket._tket.routing.QubitMap]¶

Returns a list of QubitMap objects that are Device appropriate for the given Circuit. Each QubitMap is estimated to given a similar SWAP overheard after routing.

Parameters

circuit – The circuit the maps are designed for.

modify_config(self: pytket._tket.routing.GraphPlacement, **kwargs) → None¶

Overides default Placement parameters to given values. :param **kwargs: Parameters for placement: (int)depth_limit=5, (int)max_interaction_edges=edges in the device graph, (int)max_matches=10000, (int)contraction_ratio=10.

place(self: pytket._tket.routing.GraphPlacement, circuit: pytket._tket.circuit.Circuit) → bool¶

Relabels Circuit Qubits to Device Nodes and ‘unplaced’, using GraphPlacement method.

Parameters

circuit – The Circuit being relabelled.

place_with_map(circuit: pytket._tket.circuit.Circuit, qmap: pytket._tket.routing.QubitMap) → bool¶

Relabels Circuit Qubits to Device Nodes using given map.

Parameters

  • circuit – The circuit being relabelled

  • qmap – The QubitMap the Circuit is relabelled to.

class pytket._tket.routing.HexagonalGrid¶

Architecture class for qubits arranged in a hexagonal grid lattice of given rows, length and layers

__init__(*args, **kwargs)¶

Overloaded function.

  1. __init__(self: pytket._tket.routing.HexagonalGrid, n_rows: int, ;en: int) -> None

The constructor for an architecture with some undirected connectivity between qubits.

Parameters

  • n_rows – The number of rows in the grid

  • len – The length of each row in the grid

  1. __init__(self: pytket._tket.routing.HexagonalGrid, n_rows: int, len: int, n_layers: int) -> None

The constructor for an architecture with some undirected connectivity between qubits.

Parameters

  • n_rows – The number of rows in the grid

  • n_columns – The length of each row in the grid

  • n_layers – The number of layers of grids

class pytket._tket.routing.Placement¶

The constructor for a Placement object. The Device object contains an architecture which details connectivity between qubits.

Parameters

device – A Device object.

get_placement_map(self: pytket._tket.routing.Placement, circuit: pytket._tket.circuit.Circuit) → pytket._tket.routing.QubitMap¶

Returns a QubitMap object that is Device appropriate for the given Circuit.

Parameters

circuit – The circuit a map is designed for.

get_placement_maps(self: pytket._tket.routing.Placement, circuit: pytket._tket.circuit.Circuit) → List[pytket._tket.routing.QubitMap]¶

Returns a list of QubitMap objects that are Device appropriate for the given Circuit. Each QubitMap is estimated to given a similar SWAP overheard after routing.

Parameters

circuit – The circuit the maps are designed for.

place(self: pytket._tket.routing.Placement, circuit: pytket._tket.circuit.Circuit) → bool¶

Relabels Circuit Qubits to Device Nodes and ‘unplaced’. For base Placement, all Qubits and labelled ‘unplaced’.

Parameters

circuit – The Circuit being relabelled.

Relabels Circuit Qubits to Device Nodes using given map.

Parameters

  • circuit – The circuit being relabelled

  • qmap – The QubitMap the Circuit is relabelled to.

class pytket._tket.routing.RingArch¶

Architecture class for number of qubits arranged in a ring.

The constructor for a RingArchitecture with some undirected connectivity between qubits.

:param number of qubits

class pytket._tket.routing.RoutingMethod¶

Members:

base : Default cost function for selecting SWAP networks to insert

noise : Noise-sensitive cost function for selecting SWAP networks to insert

__init__(self: pytket._tket.routing.RoutingMethod, arg0: int) → None¶
property name¶

(self: handle) -> str

class pytket._tket.routing.SquareGrid¶

Architecture class for qubits arranged in a square lattice of given number of rows and columns. Qubits are arranged with qubits values increasing first along rows then along columns i.e. for a 3 x 3 grid:

0 1 2

3 4 5

6 7 8

__init__(*args, **kwargs)¶

Overloaded function.

  1. __init__(self: pytket._tket.routing.SquareGrid, n_rows: int, n_columns: int) -> None

The constructor for a Square Grid architecture with some undirected connectivity between qubits.

Parameters

  • n_rows – The number of rows in the grid

  • n_columns – The number of columns in the grid

  1. __init__(self: pytket._tket.routing.SquareGrid, n_rows: int, n_columns: int, n_layers: int) -> None

The constructor for a Square Grid architecture with some undirected connectivity between qubits.

Parameters

  • n_rows – The number of rows in the grid

  • n_columns – The number of columns in the grid

  • n_layers – The number of layers of grids

qind_to_squind(self: pytket._tket.routing.SquareGrid, index: int) → Tuple[int, int]¶

Converts a single qubit index to a (row,column) index for a square grid.

Parameters

index – The global qubit index

Returns

The corresponding grid index as a pair (row,column)

squind_to_qind(self: pytket._tket.routing.SquareGrid, row: int, column: int) → int¶

Converts a (row,column) index for a square grid to a single qubit index

Parameters

  • row – The given row index

  • column – The given column index

Returns

The corresponding global qubit index

pytket._tket.routing.convert_index_mapping(*args, **kwargs)¶

Overloaded function.

  1. convert_index_mapping(circuit: pytket._tket.circuit.Circuit, arc: pytket._tket.routing.Architecture, index_map: Dict[int, int]) -> pytket._tket.routing.QubitMap

Converts user-specified mappings from indexed qubit to indexed architecture node to use the more general UnitID type expected for routing.

Parameters

circuit – The circuit qubits are assigned from.

Param

arc: The Architecture nodes are assigned from.

Param

index_map: The map of unsigned indices to be transformed.

  1. convert_index_mapping(circuit: pytket._tket.circuit.Circuit, device: tket::Device, index_map: Dict[int, int]) -> pytket._tket.routing.QubitMap

Converts user-specified mappings from indexed qubit to indexed architecture node to use the more general UnitID type expected for routing.

Parameters

circuit – The circuit qubits are assigned from.

Param

device: The Device nodes are assigned from.

Param

index_map: The map of unsigned indices to be transformed.

pytket._tket.routing.place_with_map(circuit: pytket._tket.circuit.Circuit, qmap: pytket._tket.routing.QubitMap) → None¶

Relabels Circuit Qubits to QubitMap provided. If provided QubitMap is partial, remaining Circuit Qubits are left ‘unplaced’.

Parameters

  • circuit – The Circuit being relabelled.

  • qmap – QubitMap object for Circuit.

pytket._tket.routing.route(*args, **kwargs)¶

Overloaded function.

  1. route(circuit: pytket._tket.circuit.Circuit, architecture: pytket._tket.routing.Architecture, **kwargs) -> pytket._tket.circuit.Circuit

Routes the circuit subject to the connectivity of the input architecture, given configuration settings.

Parameters

  • circuit – The circuit to be routed.

  • architecture – A representation of the qubit connectivity constraints of the device.

  • **kwargs – Parameters for routing: (int)swap_lookahead=50, (int)bridge_lookahead=4, (int)bridge_interactions=2, (float)bridge_exponent=0, (RoutingMethod)routing_method = RoutingMethod.base.

Returns

The routed circuit.

  1. route(circuit: pytket._tket.circuit.Circuit, device: tket::Device, **kwargs) -> pytket._tket.circuit.Circuit

Routes the circuit subject to the connectivity of the input architecture, given configuration settings.

Parameters

  • circuit – The circuit to be routed.

  • device – A representation of the qubit connectivity constraints and fidelity information of the device.

  • **kwargs – Parameters for routing: (int)swap_lookahead=50, (int)bridge_lookahead=4, (int)bridge_interactions=2, (float)bridge_exponent=0, (RoutingMethod)routing_method = RoutingMethod.base.

Returns

The routed circuit.
